bioghist.p: The Industrial Research Unit of the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania was founded in 1921 with a mission to "study the economic and social problems of business." From its inception to World War II, the Department attracted worldwide attention for its pioneering studies of industrial relations. The department contributes articles to professional industrial relations and legal journals around the world, and it publishes book on labor relations, human resources, and employment policy. In the mid 1970s, the Unit formed the Multinational Research Advisory Group. In 1990, the institution was renamed "The Center for Human Resources". The present center is focused on the study of human resources and labor and personnel management.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of information on various national and international trade federations compiled by the Wharton School Industrial Research Unit between the 1970s and 1990s. Materials include: newsletters, bulletins, reports, policy statements, press releases, and memoranda from the trade federations. Federations represented in the collection include: International Transport Workers Federation (ITF); International Confederation of Free Trade Unions (ICFTU); International Federation of Chemical, Energy and General Workers Unions (ICEF), International Metalworkers Federation. The collection also includes newspaper clippings and photocopies of clippings and articles about trade unions; and correspondence between faculty of the Industrial Research Unit and members of various trade union federations. Some materials are in German, French, and Spanish.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
